title.narrative: OUTPUT 11:CP POLICIES, LEGISLATION & SOP

description.narrative: Child protection policies, legislation and Standard Operating Procedures reviewed, amended and/or developed based on knowledge and capacity to protect children is strengthened, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2017, an enabling environment is strengthened to protect boys and girls from abuse, violence and injuries in Sri Lanka

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF PROBATION CHILD CARE SERVICES NORTHERN PROVINCE
EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY UVA PROVINCE UNDER THE MINISTRY OF EDUCATION IN UVA

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child protection policies, legislation and Standard Operating Procedures reviewed, amended and/or developed based on knowledge; andcapacity to protect children is strengthened

description.narrative: Intense advocacy resulted in increasing the minimum age of criminal responsibility from 8-12 years, which will reduce the number of children placed in institutions and in contact with the justice system. The Government is also reviewing UNICEF's recommendations to reform the legal/institutional framework focusing on justice for children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: CP officers received CP Diploma certificate (SDDP project areas)
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms

(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Key articles of the CRC (Art 19, Art 34 and Art 38 + Optional Protocol on the sale of children, child prostitution and child pornography and Optional Protocol on the involvement of children in armed conflict) dealing with violence, exploitation and abuse have been domesticated into national legislation

baseline.value: The current legislation sets the minimum age for criminal responsibility at 8

target.value: 2017:Legislation amended to increase the minimum age of criminal responsibility to 12

actual.value: 2017:National policy was amended to increase the minimum age of criminal responsibility to 12
